com.jmex.physics
Class PhysicsNode

java.lang.Object
  com.jme.scene.SceneElement
      com.jme.scene.Spatial
          com.jme.scene.Node
              com.jmex.physics.PhysicsNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jme.util.export.Savable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DynamicPhysicsNode, StaticPhysicsNode
public abstract class PhysicsNode
extends com.jme.scene.Node

A PhysicsNode defines a physical entity. Its children may be graphical and physical scenegraph Spatial. The graphical Spatials are used for visual representation and may be used for automatic computation of physical representation (see generatePhysicsGeometry(), PhysicsCollisionGeometry). The physical Spatials define the collision bounds for the physics simulation. Advanced implementation may even use them for mass distribution of dynamic nodes.

PhysicsNodes are created solely by the PhysicsSpace (methods PhysicsSpace.createDynamicNode() and PhysicsSpace.createStaticNode()).

Author:
Irrisor
See Also:
generatePhysicsGeometry(), DynamicPhysicsNode, StaticPhysicsNode, PhysicsCollisionGeometry, Serialized Form

Method Detail

getSpace

public abstract PhysicsSpace getSpace()
Returns:
space this node belongs to, must not be null

isStatic

public abstract boolean isStatic()
Returns:
true if this is a static (passive, immovable) node.

generatePhysicsGeometry

public void generatePhysicsGeometry()
This method generates physics geometry bounds for detecting collision from the graphical representation in this PhysicsNode.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no graphical representation is present (no Geometries within this Node)
See Also:
PhysicsCollisionGeometry

generatePhysicsGeometry

public void generatePhysicsGeometry(boolean useTriangleAccurateGeometries)
This method generates physics geometry bounds for detecting collision from the graphical representation in this PhysicsNode.

Parameters:
useTriangleAccurateGeometries - true to use triangle accuracy for collision detection with arbitrary geometries - use with care! (makes it expensive to compute collisions)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no graphical representation is present (no Geometries within this Node)
See Also:
PhysicsCollisionGeometry

setActive

public boolean setActive(boolean value)
Activate the node when added to a space. Deactivate when removed.

Parameters:
value - true when activated
Returns:
true if node was (de)activated, false if state was already set to value

getMaterial

public Material getMaterial()
Query default material of this node. If no material was set for a geometry the material of this physics node is returned.

Returns:
material used for inheriting geometries, not null
See Also:
PhysicsCollisionGeometry.getMaterial()

setMaterial

public void setMaterial(Material value)
Change material of this node. All geometries that did not have a matrial set as well as those with the same material like the node inherit this nodes material.

Parameters:
value - new material
See Also:
PhysicsCollisionGeometry.setMaterial(com.jmex.physics.material.Material)

getCollisionEventHandler

public com.jme.input.util.SyntheticButton getCollisionEventHandler()
Creates a synthetic button that is triggered when this node collides with another node.

Returns:
a synthetic button that is triggered on a collision event that involves this node
See Also:
PhysicsSpace.getCollisionEventHandler()

mergeWith

public abstract void mergeWith(PhysicsNode other)
Merges the set of children of the given node into this one's. The given node will have its children removed.

Parameters:
other - PhysicsNode whose children are moved to this one.
